Source code for Playground.Functional_Programing.pattern_matching

from multipledispatch import dispatch



[docs]class Thing(object): pass




[docs]class Rock(Thing):
    def __init__(self):
        self.name = "ROCK"

    def __repr__(self):
        return self.name




[docs]class Paper(Thing):
    def __init__(self):
        self.name = "PAPER"

    def __repr__(self):
        return self.name




[docs]class Scissors(Thing):
    def __init__(self):
        self.name = "SCISSORS"

    def __repr__(self):
        return self.name




[docs]class RPS:

    @dispatch(Rock, Rock)
    def beats(x, y):
        return None

    @dispatch(Rock, Paper)
    def beats(x, y):
        return y

    @dispatch(Rock, Scissors)
    def beats(x, y):
        return x

    @dispatch(Paper, Rock)
    def beats(x, y):
        return x

    @dispatch(Paper, Paper)
    def beats(x, y):
        return None

    @dispatch(Paper, Scissors)
    def beats(x, y):
        return x

    @dispatch(Scissors, Rock)
    def beats(x, y):
        return y

    @dispatch(Scissors, Paper)
    def beats(x, y):
        return x

    @dispatch(Scissors, Scissors)
    def beats(x, y):
        return None

    @dispatch(object, object)
    def beats(x, y):
        if not isinstance(x, (Rock, Paper, Scissors)):
            raise TypeError("Unknown first thing")
        else:
            raise TypeError("Unknown second thing")



if __name__ == '__main__':
    game = RPS()
    print(game.beats(Rock(), Paper()))
    print(game.beats(Rock(), Scissors()))
    print(game.beats(Scissors(), Paper()))
    print(game.beats(Scissors(), Scissors()))
